meanings.sent1: The garbage in the bin can stink after a few days.
meanings.sent2: The old socks in the room stink so much!
meanings.sent3: The stink from the dirty laundry made everyone hold their noses.
meanings.sent4: The lies he told began to stink like rotten fish.
meanings.sent5: The stink of the skunk was so strong, it lingered for hours.

meanings.sent1: The stink from the garbage was unbearable.
meanings.sent2: There was a terrible stink coming from the bathroom.
meanings.sent3: The stink in the room was so bad, it made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The stink of failure filled the air after the exam.
meanings.sent5: The stink of the rotten eggs made everyone gag.

meanings.definition: To be very bad or unpleasant.
meanings.sent1: His attitude can really stink sometimes.
meanings.sent2: The situation began to stink as more problems arose.
meanings.sent3: The food might stink to some, but others love it.
meanings.sent4: The corruption in the company started to stink like a rotten apple.
meanings.sent5: The betrayal by his friend made everything stink of dishonesty.
